Low.preparation: Enhance field drainage, prevent water stagnation around corn plants
Mix neem cake @ 500 kg per acre into soil before planting
Apply Trichoderma harzianum @ 2.5 kg per acre as soil treatment

Medium.preparation: Mix well-decomposed compost and biochar into soil to improve soil health
Prepare garlic extract by soaking 200g crushed garlic in 1 liter water for 24 hours, strain and apply to soil
Implement strategic crop rotation with non-host crops to break disease cycle

High.preparation: Solarize soil by covering with transparent plastic for 4-6 weeks during peak summer
Integrate multiple biological agents: Trichoderma, Bacillus subtilis, and Pseudomonas fluorescens
Complete removal of infected crop, deep plowing, and replanting with resistant varieties

Low.preparation: Mix 5% neem oil with water and a few drops of soap, then spray on affected plants.
Blend 100g garlic with 1 liter of water, strain, and spray on affected areas.
Dissolve 1 tablespoon of baking soda in 1 liter of water and spray on leaves.

Medium.preparation: Use Bacillus subtilis bio-fungicide diluted as per manufacturer's instructions.
Soak seeds in hot water at 50°C for 10-15 minutes before planting.
Prepare a Bordeaux mixture with 100g copper sulfate and 100g lime in 10 liters of water.

High.preparation: Remove and destroy all infected plant debris to prevent further spread.
Apply Trichoderma harzianum @ 2.5 kg per acre as soil treatment.
Replace susceptible corn varieties with resistant ones.

Low.preparation: Boil 500g neem leaves in 2 liters of water for 30 minutes, strain, and spray on affected plants.
Dilute milk with water (1:3 ratio) and spray on leaves to enhance plant immunity.
Dissolve 1 tablespoon of baking soda in 1 liter of water and spray on leaves.

Medium.preparation: Use a solution of Bacillus subtilis as per manufacturer’s instructions for foliar application.
Prepare a Bordeaux mixture with 100g copper sulfate and 100g lime in 10 liters of water.
Dilute compost tea with water (1:5) and apply to soil around the plants.

High.preparation: Rotate corn crops with non-host plants to disrupt disease cycles.
Remove all infected plant material and practice good hygiene in the field.
Apply Trichoderma harzianum @ 2.5 kg per acre as a soil treatment.

Low.preparation: Mix 5% neem oil with water and a few drops of soap, then spray on affected plants.
Blend 100g garlic with 1 liter of water, strain, and spray on affected areas.
Dissolve 1 tablespoon of baking soda in 1 liter of water and spray on leaves.

Medium.preparation: Use Bacillus subtilis bio-fungicide diluted as per manufacturer's instructions.
Soak seedlings in hot water at 50°C for 10-15 minutes before planting.
Prepare a Bordeaux mixture with 100g copper sulfate and 100g lime in 10 liters of water.

Replace susceptible sugarcane varieties with resistant ones.
